intro: Conopodium baetica, commonly known as the Iberian bladder nut, is a perennial herb native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its hairy stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. Its fruits are small, bladder-like structures that contain the seeds. Conopodium baetica is often found in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate.
